metadata.purpose: Minimum sample size for credible intersectional fairness auditing with survey data

majority_miss_test.description: Can we confirm FNR > 0.50 (model misses majority)?

gap_detection_test.description: Can we confirm FNR gap vs castellano (0.75 vs 0.633)?

conclusion: Detecting FNR > 0.50 at 80% power requires 46 dropout observations (~8 ENAHO years). Detecting the gap vs castellano requires 192 (~32 years). Survey-based intersectional fairness auditing cannot produce significant results for groups contributing ~6 positive observations per survey year. This demonstrates why administrative data (SIAGIE) must be opened for meaningful intersectional auditing.
